trend_summary: Small villages slowly expanded along main roads while farmland stayed dominant. Fields consolidated, hedgerows shrank, and selective afforestation thickened northern patches. A new industrial-airstrip complex emerged in the south-east. Despite modest growth, the landscape remains sparsely built and distinctly rural.
notable_changes: Incremental growth of village cores, with new housing clusters along primary roads.
Field amalgamation created larger, more uniform agricultural parcels, reducing hedgerow density.
Appearance of a rectangular industrial/airstrip facility in the south-eastern sector.
Net gain of forest cover in the north-west, contrasting with some clearance in the south.
Minor road realignments and bypass segments added, improving regional connectivity.
